newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippine crude imports up 2.2 pct in Q1.
newsitem.headline: Philippine crude imports up 2.2 pct in Q1.

text.p: Philippine crude imports rose 2.2 percent to 32.41 million barrels in the first quarter of the year against 31.70 million in the same period last year, the Energy Department said on Thursday.
Oil import bills totalled $724 million, up from $586 million in the same period due to the higher world market price.
"The average FOB crude price during the first quarter period of 1997 rose by 19.4 percent from $17.35 per barrel in 1996 to $20.71 per barrel," the report said.
Imports of other petroleum products, lubricants and additives reached 2.71 million barrels from 2.66 million posted last year.
The average FOB cost of petroleum products for the same period also rose 35.3 percent to $29.11 a barrel from $21.51.
